snippet: A State Supreme Court ruling calls for eight congressional districts to be redrawn within 100 days, finding evidence of political gerrymandering at work.
abstract: Florida Supreme Court upholds ruling that 2012 redistricting was partisan gerrymandering by Republican-led Legislature and orders eight districts to be re-drawn within 100 days; decision could complicate preparations for 2016 elections.
lead_paragraph: A State Supreme Court ruling calls for eight congressional districts to be redrawn within 100 days, finding evidence of political gerrymandering at work.

headline.main: Florida Court Finds Politics Determined District Lines
headline.print_headline: Florida Court Finds Politics Determined District Lines
